Posts.Title: Pink Gloves On - Back in the ring for Round 3!!

Posts.Content: My vision got blurry after the AC portion of chemo, when I was on Taxol and Herceptin. I mentioned it to my oncologist and she said it wasn't a side affect of chemo, but about a month after I finished chemo my eyes went back to my pre-chemo vision.
Posts.Title: Taxol or perhaps A/C changed my eyesight!

Posts.Content: Congrats on the 1/2 way point! I just started the A/C portion yesterday afternoon, so hope to be where you are in 2 months! Good luck with the Taxol! Hugs, Marcy
Posts.Title: Last A/C!

Posts.Content: Have a great Birthday Week! Hugs, Marcy
Posts.Title: Today is Rainbow4's Birthday!

Posts.Content: I'm in Central Jersey and spent WAY too much time watching TV today! My hubby and daughter have been doing the shoveling. The snow is really wet and heavy, so I left it to them! Wondering if school will be closed again tomorrow....I'm guessing yes. There's another storm coming Monday? Starting to remind me of when I lived in upstate NY! Where's my snowmobile when I need it?!
Posts.Title: SOCKED WITH SNOW......IN PHILADELPHIA

Posts.Content: Beach and margarita sounds great! Glad I didn't go back to work THIS week. I'm starting next Tuesday and hoping for better weather for the rest of the winter! Luckily we didn't lose power either, but the branches on our pine trees are bent right down the the ground.
Posts.Title: SOCKED WITH SNOW......IN PHILADELPHIA

Posts.Content: You gals are the best! Marcy
Posts.Title: Today is CanoeGirl's Birthday!

Posts.Content: They are beautiful! The pictures make me smile....Thanks for posting them! My girls are 17 & 20, so not many little ones around here right now. You're blessed with a beautiful family. Hugs, Marcy
Posts.Title: New photos of Brooke and Charlie

Posts.Content: I feel like I haven't slept in months! Occasionally I take Ambien, but I'm afraid to get adicted to it, so I don't use it too often. I find that after a week or so of no sleep my emotions get out of control, so I use the Ambien for a couple of nights and that seems to help. I do get a little sleep when my hubby is out of town. Between his snoring and the heat radiating off his body and triggering even more hot flashes I can't seem to sleep when he's here. Of course I'm still not getting a lot of sleep even when he's gone. Does this get any better with time? Do the hot flashes go away? I spend the day exhausted and then as soon as I lay down, I wake up! I think I need to try and get more exercise and see if that helps at all.
Posts.Title: Sleep?

Posts.Content: Try not to panic. I had micro-calcifications clustered together in 1995 had a lumectomy and they were interductal hyperplasia. Had them again in 2001 in the same spot and doctor was sure I had cancer. Once again interdauctal hyperplasia. Unfortunately this year I had a mass and 3 areas of casting calcifications and it turned out to be IDC and DCIS with 2 postive nodes. (ER, PR, HER +). Hope yours turns out to be benign, but I can see the value of Tamoxifen if it IS precancerous. Good luck, I know it's hard to wait for the biopsi and results. Hang in there! Hugs, Marcy
Posts.Title: Cluster Calcifications
